intro: Duguetia bahiensis, commonly known as the Brazilian star apple, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a member of the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by yellow or orange fruits resembling small apples. The fruit has a sweet, aromatic pulp and is often consumed fresh or used in culinary applications. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in rainforests and secondary growth areas.
